summary: This bill, the Expanding Access to School Meals Act of 2025, aims to broaden access to free and reduced-price school meals. It eliminates reduced-price breakfasts and lunches. It raises the income threshold for free lunch eligibility to 224% of the poverty level. The bill also includes provisions for direct certification of children receiving Medicaid benefits, retroactive reimbursement for eligible meals, and increases the multiplier for the community eligibility program.  The changes are set to begin in the 2025-2026 school year.
